items.title: Amazon is finally lunching Drone delivery in California
items.content_html:
Amazon just announced that they are finally lunching a fleet of delivery drones in areas of Lockeford California. Amazon worked with the FAA (Federal Aviation Administration) and local officials in order to gain proper premotions for the drones to take flight.

"Lockeford residents will soon have access to one of the world's leading delivery innovations, It's exciting that Amazon will be listening to the feedback of the San Joaquin County community to inform the future development of this technology." - CSAHF

Amazon has been working on Drone Delivery for a number of years and gained proper FAA approval back in 2020,  but do to the pandemic and other internal problems at amazon the project was on hiatus until recently.

Once the system lunches, amazon costumers in the city of Lockeford will be able to receive a majority of medium to small products form prime air. The drones will be using spicily developed sense-and-avoid systems in order to operate safely and avoid obstacles like plants, dogs, humans, Etc.
items.summary:
Amazon just announced that they are finally lunching a fleet of delivery drones in areas of Lockeford California. Amazon worked with the FAA (Federal Aviation Administration) and local officials in order to gain proper premotions for the drones to take flight.

"Lockeford residents will soon have access to one

items.title: Starfield will let players explore 1,000+ planets in a vast open world galaxy
items.content_html:
Earlier today (Sunday 12, 2022) Starfield was showcased at an Xbox Showcase with an extended gameplay demo. The demo showed the majority scope of the Sci-fi RPG featuring more that 1000 planets across 100 systems, it also shows the amount of detail that has gone into planets and other surroundings.

Other gameplay details Reveal that the game will start with the main player (you) landing on the moon of Kreet. Alien life is present but doesn't appear to be hostile. On the moon you will eventually reach a facility used by pirates and this is where the gunplay and action truly begins.

 Starfield is the first new franchise from Bethesda in 25 years and was originally going to be released this year, but the game was delayed due the pandemic. and a new relace date has been set for early to mid 2023.
items.summary: Earlier today (Sunday 12, 2022) Starfield was showcased at an Xbox Showcase with an extended gameplay demo. The demo showed the majority scope of the Sci-fi RPG featuring more that 1000 planets across 100 systems, it also shows the amount of detail that has gone into planets and other surroundings.

items.title: Austin Tx, First city to pass The CROWN act
items.content_html:
Austin Tx just became the first city to pass the CROWN act witch is set to help eliminate hair discrimination across the U.S and potently worldwide. CROWN  stands for "Creating a Respectful and Open World for Natural Hair". and was approved by the Austin city counsel June 9th.

The act will amend City Code and will revise the definition of "Discriminatory Employment Practice" and it will include protective hairstyles.

This means a hairstyle necessitated by, or resulting from, the characteristics of a hair texture or hairstyle commonly associated with race, national origin, ethnicity, or culture, - Fox7 Austin

The act also includes but is not limited to afros, bantu knots, braids, cornrows, curls, locs, twists, and hair that is tightly coiled or tightly curled. Austin officials  state that  this ACT will ensure that discrimination can and will be addressed before protections become introduced nationally.
items.summary: Austin Tx just became the first city to pass the CROWN act witch is set to help eliminate hair discrimination across the U.S and potently worldwide. CROWN  stands for "Creating a Respectful and Open World for Natural Hair". and was approved by the Austin city counsel

items.title: New Studies show that Colorado is on track to loose around 50% of its total snow by 2080
items.content_html:
According to reports and data from the journal Earth and Space Sciences its predicted that Colorado will lose between 50% and 60% of its snow by 2080 due to the current climate crisis.

“Changes in future climate within the Colorado River Basin are especially concerning due to the CRB’s reliance on high-elevation snowpack for annual runoff,” the study states. “The combined pressures of increasing vapor pressure deficit and loss of snowmelt could drive this region to experience a severe decrease in existing soil moisture, regardless of precipitation changes.” - Segment from ESS

Researchers have gathered more than enough substantial evidence to back these claims, based on existing data gathered from the past 30 years things only look worse for future generations unless something is done soon.
Researchers have also noted that some states such as Wyoming and Utah that surround Colorado will also see some major changes though not as severe.

“We’re not saying Colorado is going to become a desert. But we see increased aridity moving forward - Katrina Bennett LANL"
items.summary:
According to reports and data from the journal Earth and Space Sciences its predicted that Colorado will lose between 50% and 60% of its snow by 2080 due to the current climate crisis.

“Changes in future climate within the Colorado River Basin are especially concerning due to the CRB&

items.title: MacOS Ventura unveiled at WWDC22 Keynote
items.content_html:
Apple just reviled the all new MacOS Ventura with improved existing features and new features.

MacOS Ventura will have a new stage manager, which is basically a fancy way in saying multitasking. It will allow you to focus on any specific app without the distractions and will also allow other apps to be open on the side or pushed away.

Stage manager will be able to gather all open app windows together into a single pile so that users can drag files directly onto the apps pile.

Apple has also updated Spotlight; Spotlight will now be able to find images for your photo library system-wide and web-wide. Craig Federighi also mentioned that you will also be able to search test inside of the image similar to the existing feature found in IOS 15.

The updates just keep on coming, Apple has also announced new features for mail. Mail will be getting new productivity tools, including the ability to react to emails, users of MacOS Ventura will also gain the ability to schedule an email a feature that so many users have been waiting for for years.

Oh, and there is one more thing... according to Apple all silicon Macs and even some older Intel-based MacBooks will be able to run MacOs Ventura. At this current moment, it's unknown what exactly will and will not be supported but it seems likely that anything 2017 up will have support.
items.summary:
Apple just reviled the all new MacOS Ventura with improved existing features and new features.

MacOS Ventura will have a new stage manager, which is basically a fancy way in saying multitasking. It will allow you to focus on any specific app without the distractions and will also allow other

items.title: Apple announces new M2 MacBook Pro and Air
items.content_html:
An All new MacBook Air with the M2 chip took the stage during Apples WWDC22 keynote, and a MacBook Pro also featuring the M2 chip took the stage immediately after. These new MacBooks will feature MagSafe charging, Thunderbolt ports, and a headphone jack and for the M2 air all that comes in a housing that's 11mm thick and weigh's 2.7 pounds. However on the Pro side its the same as last years model just upgraded specifications.

The Macbook air has seen a much needed redesign with new colors such as silver, space grey, and new “starlight” and “midnight” colors. Ths MacBook Will also have a squared look resembling the existing 2021 Macbook Pro. The MacBook Air will feature a liquid retina display at the size of 13.6 inches and will have a brightness of 500 nits at 1 billion colors. This MacBook will also feature a notch similar to existing models and will have a 1080p camera with 2x low light performance.

This MacBook will use the same Magsafe power adapter that other current gen MacBook's have, it will also feature 2 USB-C ports that will support fast charging at up to 80% in just 20 minutes.
items.summary: An All new MacBook Air with the M2 chip took the stage during Apples WWDC22 keynote, and a MacBook Pro also featuring the M2 chip took the stage immediately after. These new MacBooks will feature MagSafe charging, Thunderbolt ports, and a headphone jack and for the M2 air all

items.title: Multiple Active Shooters Open Fire in Busy Philadelphia Street, Killing 3 People and Wounding 11 Others
items.content_html:
On Saturday evening, several active shooters opened fire on South Street in Philadelphia, killing at least 3 people and injuring 11 others.

One of the suspects had been shot at by one of the officers, reportedly causing him to drop his weapon and flee. The suspect was also shot in the arm, but sources say that it is not clear whether it was from the officer's shooting or not. An employee of a nearby restaurant, Eric Walsh, said that gunshots were heard around half an hour before midnight. He described how tons of people came into their restaurant with blood on their bodies, and how he was handing napkins to people to wipe the blood off, showing how gory the situation was.

"People were coming off the street with blood splatters on white sneakers and skinned knees and skinned elbows... we literally just were balling up napkins and wetting them and handing them to people... it was chaos." -Eric Walsh, O'Neals Pub Employee.

There were hundreds of people on the busy street during the incident. No arrests have been made yet, but police say that two handguns and an extended magazine were found. The first suspect being tracked down is a woman in a 2018 Volkswagen Atlas (again, there are multiple suspects). Not much data has been released on the victims at the time of this article.

There had been nine other separate shootings from the night before this shooting just in Philadelphia, according to Philadelphia police.
items.summary:
On Saturday evening, several active shooters opened fire on South Street in Philadelphia, killing at least 3 people and injuring 11 others.

One of the suspects had been shot at by one of the officers, reportedly causing him to drop his weapon and flee. The suspect was also shot in

items.title: Researcher's At MIT and Brigham have developed a GEL replacement for pills.
items.content_html:
For a large number of children and some adults, swallowing pills or tablets can be difficult. This problem has been plaguing humankind for decades but researchers at MIT, Brigham, and The Women’s Hospital have created a GEL replacement that's much easier to swallow and can be used to administer a variety of different drugs.

MIT states that the gels are made from plant-based oils such as sesame oil and can be prepared with a variety of textures from a thickened beverage like a smoothie or a yogurt-like substance. These different textures allow for patients like stroke victims to take the drugs that they need in a much easier way.

“This platform will change our capacity for what we can do for kids, and also for adults who have difficulty receiving medication. Given the simplicity of the system and its low cost, it could have a tremendous impact on making it easier for patients to take medications,” - MIT, Brigham, and Woman's hospital.
items.summary: For a large number of children and some adults, swallowing pills or tablets can be difficult. This problem has been plaguing humankind for decades but researchers at MIT, Brigham, and The Women’s Hospital have created a GEL replacement that's much easier to swallow and can be

items.title: Tesla Plans to cut 10% of Salaried Employees
items.content_html:
Elon Musk told staff in an email on Friday that he is planning to cut 10% of Tesla's workforce. "We have become overstaffed in many areas,” Musk said in the email. After the news got out, Tesla's share price dropped 9% on Friday.

A few days ago, Elon Musk told employees of Tesla, "Anyone who wishes to do remote work must be in the office for a minimum (and I mean *minimum*) of 40 hours per week or depart Tesla," in an email obtained by Electrek. The announcements are a part of Musk's movement to return to normal after two years of COVID-19 and remote working.
items.summary:
Elon Musk told staff in an email on Friday that he is planning to cut 10% of Tesla's workforce. "We have become overstaffed in many areas,” Musk said in the email. After the news got out, Tesla's share price dropped 9% on Friday.

items.title: 3 People Injured in Houston Nightclub Shooting
items.content_html:
On Saturday morning, a shooting outside a Houston nightclub left a woman in critical condition, and two other men (stable) injured.

The gunman reportedly started shooting in a parking lot outside the nightclub from a U-Haul truck, as stated by police. The shooting occurred after 4 A.M., according to Houston Police Assistant Chief Chandra Hatcher. Several people are detained.

This is a developing story, more information will be added by MTK News contributors when it becomes available.
items.summary:
On Saturday morning, a shooting outside a Houston nightclub left a woman in critical condition, and two other men (stable) injured.

items.title: California Approves Autonomous Taxi Rides
items.content_html:
On Thursday, the California Public Utilities Commission voted to give Cruise, a General Motors company that makes autonomous cars, permission to begin driverless taxi rides in San Francisco.

The company will use a line of 30 driverless electric Chevrolet Bolts to carry passengers around the city. Cruise will be the first company to operate a commercial autonomous taxi service in a major US city, the COO of Cruise, Gil West, stated. The regulators required that the vehicles travel at a maximum speed of 30 MPH. The service will be active from 10 PM to 6 AM every day, and when weather conditions are fit for use.

In April, General Motors noted that it will spend $2 billion this year on Cruise. The company has not made a profit yet but is expected to once the service is operational. Cruise CEO Dan Ammann said that he aims to reach $50 billion in revenue over the next eight years. GM is reportedly developing a car called the Origin in a partnership with Honda, which Cruise plans to use in the future. The car will have no steering wheel or gas pedal. Production for this vehicle is expected to begin in early 2023 at Factory Zero, Detriot.

Elon Musk had previously promised that Tesla would be operating a robotic taxi division by 2020, which was later failed to meet.
items.summary:
On Thursday, the California Public Utilities Commission voted to give Cruise, a General Motors company that makes autonomous cars, permission to begin driverless taxi rides in San Francisco.

The company will use a line of 30 driverless electric Chevrolet Bolts to carry passengers around the city. Cruise will be the

items.title: Johnny Depp found Not Guilty in defamation trial against ex-wife amber heard
items.content_html:
Around 3:20 PM eastern daylight time the judge Penney Azcarate announced that Actor Johnny Depp won the defamation trial against EX wife Amber Heard.

Johnny Depp filed a lawsuit against his ex-wife Amber heard over a 2018 op-ed that she had written in the Washington Post. She referred to herself as a public figure representing domestic abuse. Depp Is seeking 5o million in damages, stating that even though the op-ed did not directly mention him, the piece ruined his reputation and career because she had referred to the period two years prior when she had filed for divorce and a restraining order.

During court, Depp denied all claims of abuse, and had more than enough substantial evidence to prove so.
items.summary:
Around 3:20 PM eastern daylight time the judge Penney Azcarate announced that Actor Johnny Depp won the defamation trial against EX wife Amber Heard.

Johnny Depp filed a lawsuit against his ex-wife Amber heard over a 2018 op-ed that she had written in the Washington Post. She referred to

items.title: All 2nd generation Starlink Satellites have been temporarily grounded
items.content_html:
Elon musk's Starlink satellite internet service has finally developed the second generation of satellites for low-earth orbit. But SpaceX says that they are currently still too big to take off.

SpaceX says that Gen2 satellites are 22 feet long and weigh 2,755 pounds. When compared to the first generation, which only weighed 573 pounds, that is considerably smaller.

"A lot of people talk a lot about how many launches per year there are to orbit, but this is not really what matters. I think what really matters is what's the total useful payload to orbit per year, Cause otherwise you could say if this were ocean ships, you'd be like comparing a dinghy to a supertanker." - Elon Musk

For SpaceX to even consider getting the satellite into space at the current weight, they would have to prepare a Starship Heavy-lift rocket, and that's no small rocket.
items.summary:
Elon musk's Starlink satellite internet service has finally developed the second generation of satellites for low-earth orbit. But SpaceX says that they are currently still too big to take off.

SpaceX says that Gen2 satellites are 22 feet long and weigh 2,755 pounds. When compared to the

items.title: New Tropical System Likely to Impact Florida
items.content_html:
The National Hurricane Center is monitoring a new tropical system, "Invest 91L", developing near the Yucatan Peninsula and Southeastern Gulf of Mexico. Today marks the first day of the 2022 Atlantic Hurricane Season, running from June 1st to November 30th. NOAA predicts between 14 and 21 named storms to form this season, with 6-10 becoming hurricanes, and 3-6 becoming major hurricanes (Category 3 - Category 5).

Invest 91L has a 70% chance of formation in the next 48 hours, and an 80% chance of formation in the next 5 days, according to the NHC. It is expected to move northeastward over the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and northwestern Carribean Sea over the next few days. Heavy rainfall is expected in southeastern Mexico, the Yucatan Peninsula, Belize, South Florida, Cuba, and the Florida Keys. The European model shows the system moving northeast cutting through Central Florida. The GFS model shows the system moving through between Cuba and the Florida Keys, traveling towards the Bahamas. However, the European model tends to be more historically accurate. If this storm does form (which is very likely), it will be named Alex.

Here is the full list of names for the 2022 Atlantic Hurricane Season:

  • Alex
  • Bonnie
  • Colin
  • Danielle
  • Earl
  • Fiona
  • Gaston
  • Hermine
  • Ian
  • Julia
  • Karl
  • Lisa
  • Martin
  • Nicole
  • Owen
  • Paula
  • Richard
  • Shary
  • Tobias
  • Virginie
  • Walter
items.summary: The National Hurricane Center is monitoring a new tropical system, "Invest 91L", developing near the Yucatan Peninsula and Southeastern Gulf of Mexico. Today marks the first day of the 2022 Atlantic Hurricane Season, running from June 1st to November 30th. NOAA predicts between 14 and 21 named storms

items.title: iOS 16 could finally bring an Always-on lock screen to iPhones
items.content_html:
According to Bloomberg's Mark Gurman, iOS 16 could finally bring an always-on display for the future iPhone 14 Pro and 14 Pro Max.

However this was once rumored before to arrive with the iPhone 13 pro, but as you may know, that never actually happened. But according to Gurman, it seems likely that the 14 Pro and 14 Pro Max will obtain this long-awaited function. But then again, these are just rumors.

The always-on display feature in iOS 16 would also be a nice addition to the iPhone 14 Pro line following the redesign that is expected to come with a new hole-punch + pill cutout to replace the current notch.
items.summary:
